intro: Gurania pycnocephala, commonly known as the thick-headed gurania, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense, rounded inflorescences that bear showy, five-petaled flowers. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed and can vary in size depending on environmental conditions. Gurania pycnocephala is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in shaded undergrowth.
